title: Drake speaks out after father Dennis Graham claims rapper falsely painted him as absent parent
text:
Drake has spoken out about his father Dennis Graham's recent claims.

Appearing on Nick Cannon's radio show, Dennis his 32-year-old son falsely painted him as an absent parent because 'it sells records.'

'Woke up today so hurt man,' wrote Drake on his Insta Story this Tuesday. 'My father will say anything to anyone that's willing to listen to him.'

'Woke up today so hurt man': Drake has spoken out about his father Dennis Graham's recent claims; the two are pictured at the 2017 Billboard Music Awards in Las Vegas

The Canadian rap hunk continued: 'It's sad when family gets like this but what can we really do that's the people we are stuck with...every bar I spit was the truth and the truth is hard for some people to accept.'

Dennis swung by Nick's radio show last Tuesday, where the host brought up Drake's lyrics about his parents' divorce and his relationship with his father.

'I had a conversation with Drake about that. I have always been with Drake. I talk to him, if not every day, every other day,' Dennis insisted.

'And we really got into a deep conversation about that. I said: "Drake, why are you saying all this diff- stuff about me man? Like, this is not cool." And he goes: "Dad, it sells records." I said: "Okay, well, cool,"' said Dennis with a laugh.

Bold: Appearing on Nick Cannon's radio show , Dennis his 32-year-old son falsely painted him as an absent parent because 'it sells records'

'It's sad when family gets like this': Drake wrote on his Insta Story this Tuesday: 'My father will say anything to anyone that's willing to listen to him'

Dennis made a similar statement while appearing on this year's Father's Day episode of the podcast A Waste Of Time, in a clip unearthed by Complex.

'I said: "Drake, you gotta stop this man. You know that never happened." He goes: "Dad, listen man, just go with the flow. This s*** sells records,"' he alleged.

Dennis, a drummer from Memphis who has worked with such musical artists as Jerry Lee Lewis, has become involved in OVO, the record label Drake co-founded.

Aubrey Drake Graham was only five years old when his parents got divorced and his father went back to Memphis, leaving the little boy and his mother Sandi in Toronto.

Difficult subject: Dennis swung by Nick's radio show last Tuesday, where the host brought up Drake's lyrics about his parents' divorce and his relationship with his father

Drake discussed the breakup of his family on S.T.R.E.S.S., a single off his self-released debut 2006 mixtape Room For Improvement.

'My father's early careering forced my parents to split up. / My mother was a teacher. My father was kind of fed up / With just being a florist / So the choir sang his chorus.'

Drake continued: 'And he got back into doing what he was doing before us. / Because money is an issue, your son, he gon' miss you.'

His story: Dennis alleged that he once confronted Drake about the rapper's portrayal of their relationship, only to be told: 'Dad, it sells records'

He added pointedly: 'And plus you got a wife at home 'cause Mommy still exist too. / Now you looking for exes. / You ain't never expect this. / You end up doing time, and me, I end up with a step-sis.'

Drake himself became a father in 2017 when the French artist and former porn star Sophie Brussaux gave birth to his son Adonis.

Although he initially kept the matter private, rumors had been swirling since Sophie's pregnancy, and Drake confirmed the news last year.

Throwback: Drake was five when his parents divorced and his father went back to Memphis, leaving the little boy and his mother Sandi in Toronto; Drake and Sandi are pictured in 2011

Pusha T forced the topic out of the shadows on his 2018 diss track The Story Of Adidon, taunting Drake: 'You are hiding a child. Let that boy come home. / Deadbeat mothaf***a playing border patrol. Ooh.'

The Story Of Adidon was released in May, and in June, Drake released his album Scorpion, where he confessed he had a son.

'I wasn't hiding my kid from the world. I was hiding the world from my kid,' he rapped on the album's track Emotionless. 'From empty souls who just wake up and look to debate. / Until you staring at your seed, you can never relate.'
description: Appearing on Nick Cannon's radio show , Dennis his 32-year-old son falsely painted him as an absent parent because 'it sells records.'
